name: Trading – Post-Loss Reset
body:
PHASE 1 — LOSS RESPONSE (60–90 seconds)
1. 10-Second Exhale
   Let shoulders drop. Hand over sternum.
   “We are safe.”

2. Acknowledge the risk
   “I took a planned risk. This loss is the cost of doing business.”

3. The 3 Truths
   – I followed my plan
   – The stop protected me
   – One loss does not erase growth

PHASE 2 — NEUTRAL ZONE
1. Micro-Debrief
   – Was the setup valid?
   – Was my risk clear?
   – Did I respect my stop?
   – Would I take this trade again?

2. Line in the Sand
   “The trade is over. I release the rest.”

PHASE 3 — EMPOWERED STATE
1. Identity Re-Anchor
   “I am a disciplined trader. Consistency is my edge.”

2. Reorientation
   Turn 10 degrees, stretch, sip water, or glance at your rules.

3. Empowerment Seal
   “Steady gains come from steady behavior. Discipline always pays me.”

name: Trading – Post-Win Grounding
body:
1. Pause for 10 seconds and breathe.
2. Acknowledge:
   “This gain came from process, not just luck.”
3. Log the trade and note one thing you did well.
4. Say:
   “I do not chase. I repeat what works.”
5. Step away from the chart for 2–5 minutes before considering another trade.

name: Home – Parenting Boundary Reset
body:
1. Step out of the room if possible.
2. Hand to chest or sternum:
   “I am the adult nervous system here.”
3. Name the feeling out loud or silently:
   frustration, anger, hurt, helplessness.
4. Ask:
   “What boundary am I honoring right now?”
5. Choose one clear sentence to carry back in:
   “I hear you. The boundary stays.”
6. Re-enter with:
   firm voice, soft heart, clear limit.

name: Relationship – Partner Stress Support
body:
1. Notice the urge to fix or control.
2. Breathe and say internally:
   “I am here to witness, not to manage.”
3. Ask your partner:
   “Do you want comfort, solutions, or just someone to listen?”
4. Offer one validating sentence:
   “What you’re feeling makes sense.”
5. Afterward, remind yourself:
   “We’re on the same team, even under stress.”

name: Self – Acute Overwhelm Reset
body:
1. Orient to the room:
   Name 5 things you see, 4 you can touch, 3 you can hear, 2 you can smell, 1 you can taste.
2. Relax the jaw, drop the shoulders, unclench hands.
3. Say:
   “This moment is intense, not permanent.”
4. Choose one tiny next action only.
5. Optional: drink water and take three slow exhales longer than your inhales.
